modules.description: Provides configuration keys for adjusting chunk size, minimum size, and chunking strategy in a storage backend. Works with integer and variant types to control data segmentation. Used to optimize storage layout for performance and space efficiency in versioned data systems.

Controls configuration parameters for data segmentation, including chunk size, minimum size, and strategy, using integers and variants to tailor storage behavior. Key types include configuration records and variant strategies, with operations to set and retrieve parameters. Users can adjust segmentation rules to balance performance and storage efficiency in versioned systems. Example tasks include defining custom chunking policies or tuning size thresholds for specific workloads.

Provides operations to create, compare, and hash content-based identifiers using a custom type `t` derived from a specific representation. Works with binary data and cryptographic hashes to ensure unique, deterministic identifiers. Used to generate stable keys for storing and retrieving data in distributed systems.

Provides versioned storage and retrieval of custom data types with support for branching, merging, and conflict resolution. Operates on structured data and integrates with various storage backends like in-memory, disk, and remote databases. Enables automated data synchronization and pipeline management in distributed systems requiring high throughput and consistency.

Encapsulates logic for segmenting and identifying data blocks, enabling efficient storage and retrieval in versioned systems. Uses a custom type `t` for content-based identifiers and configuration records to control chunking parameters like size and strategy. Supports creating unique keys from binary data and adjusting segmentation rules to optimize performance. Can generate stable keys for distributed storage or tailor chunk sizes for large file handling.
